revision.text:
{{Wired embedded system |brand=TP-LINK |model=TL-R402M |revision=v4.0 |asin=B003CFATRO |availability=common |type=router |fcc_id= |ic_id= |pwr_v=9 |pwr_amp=0.8 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Marvell |cpu1_model=88E6218 |cpu1_cspeed=150 |fla1=512 KiB |fla1_brand=Spansion |fla1_model=S29AL004D70TFI02 |ram1=2 MiB |ram1_brand=ISSI |ram1_model=IS42S16100C1-7TL |ram1_num= |expansion_if_types= |serial= |jtag= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui_eth=00:1D:0F }} [https://picasaweb.google.com/etthtech/TPLinkTLR402MVer40PL Pictures]
The above link is dead, but I found some more technical analysis at a [http://itlab.idcquan.com/network/roupingcei/367415_6.html review] from 2006.
From here, the following information can be confirmed: *CPU: [[Marvell]] 88E6218 @150MHz *Flash: ''Spansion'' 4 Mbit (512K x 8-Bit / 256 K x 16-Bit) :CMOS 3.0 V with boot sector, using 48-pin TSOP *RAM: ''ISSI'' IC42S16100 (SDRAM) 512K x 16 Bit x 2 Banks (16-MBit) TSOP II
Also note that the size of a firmware upgrade is usually just below 512KiB.
However, according to that page, the very similar TL-R460 does have :1MB 29LV800B flash and 8MB RAM Samsung K4S641632H-TC75.
See also [[TP-LINK TL-R450 v4.0]]..
